action.action-desc: Mr. Gibbs introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to allow for modified permits for industrial minerals remining operations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Industrial Mineral Parity Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Section 301(p)(1) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1311(p)(1)) is amended by striking coal.
Section 301(p)(2) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1311(p)(2)) is amended by striking coal each place it appears.
Section 301(p)(3) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1311(p)(3)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as subparagraphs (D) and (F), respectively;
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following:

subparagraph.text: The term industrial mineral means limestone, clay, sand, gravel, diatomite, kaolin, bentonite, silica, barite, gypsum, or talc.

The term industrial minerals remining operation means an industrial minerals mining operation that begins after the date of the enactment of the Industrial Mineral Parity Act of 2017 at a site on which coal mining was conducted before the effective date of the Surface Mining Control and Reclamation Act of 1977.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), as so redesignated, by striking coal remining and inserting remining; and
by inserting after subparagraph (D), as so redesignated, the following:

subparagraph.text: The term remining operation means a coal remining operation or an industrial minerals remining operation.

subsection.text: Section 301(p)(4) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1311(p)(4)) is amended by striking coal.
Section 301(p) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1311(p)) is amended in the subsection heading by striking coal.
